newsitem.title: INDIA: India bank rate needs to be cut further says I-Sec.
newsitem.headline: India bank rate needs to be cut further says I-Sec.

text.p: A cut of at least 50 basis points needs to be made in the central bank rate to bring it in line with other interest rates in the Indian economy, according to a debt market report by ICICI Securities and Finance Company (I-Sec).
"The current yield levels on various instruments are about 50 to 100 basis points lower than the levels which prompted a cut in the bank rate to 10 percent," I-Sec said.
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut its key bank rate to 10 percent per annum from 11 percent in June. The Bank rate is the rate at which banks borrow from the central bank.
Following the cut in the Bank rate in June, several leading state-run banks cut prime rates by 50 basis points.
I-Sec said several banks have recently cut their deposit rates.
"A further cut in (bank) prime lending rates to 13 percent also looks likely," it said.
"Hence it is necessary for the RBI to reduce bank rate by at least 50 basis points to bring it in line with the reduction in the general level of interest rates in the economy."
